devdoc.details: The vesting setup is performed by passing a value as one of the fields of the TGEInfo structure called "vestingParams", which is a structure of IVesting.VestingParams. This set of settings allows you to specify: - what portion of the tokens will be released and directed to the buyer's wallet within the purchase transaction (using the TGE:purchase method); - what portion of the tokens will be available for claim after the cliff period and the duration of this period; - what percentage of the remaining tokens will be distributed equally over equal time intervals (as well as the number and duration of these intervals). Any of these fields can accept zero values, for example, you can set the distribution of tokens without a cliff period or, conversely, split the receipt of values into two parts (immediately and after some time), without specifying time intervals.For each TGE, a list of Resolvers can be assigned, i.e., addresses that can stop the vesting program for a specific user.  The list of resolvers is immutable for each individual TGE and is set at the time of its launch (it can be stored in the proposal data for creating the TGE beforehand).

Cancelled(address,address,uint256).details: This event is emitted when vesting is canceled for a specific account and TGE.

params.amount: Amount of tokens that will not be distributed to this address due to the cancellation

Claimed(address,address,uint256).details: This event is emitted for each token claiming by users.

params.account: Account address that requested the token claiming

Vested(address,address,uint256).details: This event is emitted when new token units are vested due to token purchase.

params.amount: Amount of tokens vested for the account

cancel(address,address).details: Calling this method is only possible by the address specified in the resolvers list for the specific TGE, and it leads to resetting the token balance in vesting for the specified address, depriving it of the ability to make successful token claiming within the specified TGE.

claim(address).details: This method is executed with the specified TGE, for which the currently unlocked token volume is calculated. Calling the method results in the issuance and transfer of the entire calculated token volume to the sender's address.

claimableBalanceOf(address,address).details: This method takes into account previous claimings made by the account.

returns._0: uin256 Number of claimable token units

constructor.details: This contract uses OpenZeppelin upgrades and has no need for a constructor function. The constructor is replaced with an initializer function. This method disables the initializer feature of the OpenZeppelin upgrades plugin, preventing the initializer methods from being misused.

getTrustedForwarder().details: Returns the address of the trusted forwarder.

initialize(address).details: This method replaces the constructor for upgradeable contracts. Additionally, it sets the address of the Registry contract in the contract's storage.

isTrustedForwarder(address).details: Indicates whether any particular address is the trusted forwarder.

setClaimTVLReached(address).details: This method can only be called by the address with the SERVICE_MANAGER role in the Service contract. It is a trusted way to load data into the source of truth about the TVL events achieved by the pool, as specified in the parameters of the vesting program.

unlockedBalanceOf(address,address).details: The returned value is the total sum of all quantities after all token unlocks that have occurred for this account within this TGE. In other words, claimed tokens are also part of this response.

returns._0: uint256 Number of unlocked token units
bool True if params are valid (reverts otherwise)

vest(address,uint256).details: This method is called only by the TGE contract and results in the creation of a new entry or an increase in the existing value in the vested mapping for the TGE key and the specified account. After this, the account is reserved the ability to mint and receive new token units in case the conditions specified in the vesting program for this TGE are met.

params.to: Account address that received the vested tokens

vestedBalanceOf(address,address).details: This method shows both still locked token units and already unlocked units ready for claiming.

returns._0: uint256 Number of token units vested

DENOM.details: The constant Service.sol:DENOM is used to work with percentage values of QuorumThreshold and DecisionThreshold thresholds, as well as for calculating the ProtocolTokenFee. In this version, it is equal to 1,000,000, for clarity stored as 100 * 10 ^ 4. 10^4 corresponds to one percent, and 100 * 10^4 corresponds to one hundred percent. The value of 12.3456% will be written as 123,456, and 78.9% as 789,000. This notation allows specifying ratios with an accuracy of up to four decimal places in percentage notation (six decimal places in decimal notation). When working with the CompanyDAO frontend, the application scripts automatically convert the familiar percentage notation into the required format. When using the contracts independently, this feature of value notation should be taken into account.

claimTVLReached.details: It is one of the two conditions under which users can claim tokens reserved for them under the vesting program.

claimed.details: This parameter increases every time a successful transaction is made to the Claim method by an address.

totalVested.details: Claiming tokens does not modify these data; they are used to calculate the amount of tokens that can be claimed by a specific address and to determine the total amount of tokens in vesting for a given account.In the event of vesting cancellation for a specific address in any TGE, the value under the TGE address key is decreased by the full amount of tokens locked in vesting for that address.

vested.details: The vesting contract does not store tokens, but it contains records of which address is entitled to what amount of tokens for which TGE when the conditions set in the settings are met. This means that minting these tokens only occurs when the owner of the address requests them, prior to that, they are not included in totalSupply or balances. No record in Vesting can affect the vote calculation for Governance.

devdoc.title: Vesting contract

cancel(address,address).notice: Cancels vesting for the specified account and TGE contract addresses.

claim(address).notice: Method to issue and transfer unlocked tokens to the transaction sender's address.

claimTVLReached(address).notice: Mapping of flags indicating whether the TVL threshold set in the TGE conditions has been reached by the pool.

claimableBalanceOf(address,address).notice: This method returns the currently available amount of token units that an account can claim within the specified TGE.

claimed(address,address).notice: Mapping that stores the total amount of tokens vested by a specific address for a given TGE.

resolved(address,address).notice: Mapping that shows the amount of tokens that will not be transferred to the user during claiming due to the cancellation of vesting by a resolver.

setClaimTVLReached(address).notice: Method for recording the occurrence of one of two conditions for token unlocking.

totalVested(address).notice: Mapping that stores the total amount of tokens locked in vesting for each conducted TGE.

unlockedBalanceOf(address,address).notice: This method returns the number of token units that have been unlocked for a specific account within the vesting program of a particular TGE.

validateParams((uint256,uint256,uint256,.notice: This method validates the vesting program parameters proposed for use in the created TGE contract.

vest(address,uint256).notice: Method for increasing the token balance in vesting for a specific TGE contract.

vested(address,address).notice: Mapping (tge, account) to amount of tokens vested to that account in TGE

vestedBalanceOf(address,address).notice: This method shows the remaining tokens that are still vested for a given address.

vestingParams(address).notice: This method returns the vesting parameters specified for a specific TGE.

userdoc.notice: The Vesting contract exists in a single instance and helps manage the vesting processes for all successful TGEs.
